info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 6:00AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Broome and southwestern Chenango Counties through 630 AM EDT... At 600 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Whitney Point, or 7 miles north of Greater Binghamton Airport, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Greene, Whitney Point, Lisle and Smithville Flats. This includes the following highway exits... New York Interstate 81 between 7 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
